text: Butelka 2016. Nic poza wymiotną goryczą, może lekka soja. Albo ja miałem słabszy dzień albo temu piwu czas nie służy.

This is Stones special 20th Anniversary release of their 6th Anniversary Porter - er, thats a tad confusing. Stone doesnt phone it in for their anniversary releases, that much is clear. This bottle had several months of age on it. Near-black color. Roasty, smoky, and earthy nose with some soy sauce. Roasted malt, smoke, dark chocolate, licorice, burnt cream, earth, herbal tobacco, and umami flavors. Feel is rich and hearty. Booze taste is cleverly hidden - you do feel a bit of heat. Its a straightforward Imperial Porter but an excellent one.

Bottle.

A- Savory, roasty, leather, char, soy sauce, oak.

A- Black color, black liquid, beige head.

T- Roasty, dry, char, bitter, leather, tobacco, oak.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- At well over a year old this was still heavily bitter. I cant imagine it fresh. A bit of a chalky finish and loaded with roasted tobacco and dry leather. The finish was just too bitter and chalky. Not my favorite in a style I love.
Smoky and some caramel like a collection of unhealthy habits. Black pour with decent head and lacing. Bitter and roasty finish. Dark chocolate. Good balance. Tap at city taphouse.

1pt 6fl oz bottle at home from De Caigny, Belgium. Nose is roasted malt, peat, smoky. Body is clear nearly black, head is small, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, cardboard. No sweetness, heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty heavy bitter. Medium to full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Relative easy, very bitter, interesting, nice one.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge. Pitch black color, good offwhite foam. High aroma intensity; leather, coffee, licorice,
Malt and some choclate. Medium full body & high complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very dark brown. Frothy, tan head that lingers for the duration amidst sticky lacing. A very attractive brew. Aroma is chocolate but with notable hop undertones: lots of pine, and a bit floral. More reminiscent of a black ipa than a traditional porter. Taste is bitter, almost too bitter with the hops mostly squelching the sweet chocolate and smokey undertones, but the balance is just kept and comes out strangely all the better for it. Full body, soft carbonation, rich, creamy and smooth. Absolutely delicious. A beer that leaves me sad when the glass is gone gets extra points in my book. At the time of rating among my best top ten.

Do you know this aroma, when you are very dusty, and then you get a shower? That is the kind of aroma, that i felt in this beer!!! But it wasnt unpleasant, I would say, that it was rather interesting.
22 oz bottle pours a black color with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate, oak, roasted malt, coffee. Full bodied, with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Black pour with a beige head. Aroma and taste of liqourice, chocolate, very light smoke, roast and a bit of coffee. Smooth with a full body. Lightly bitter smoked oak finish.

Po imperialnym porterze spodziewałem się ugrzecznionej wersji tego co było w RISie, jednak jest to piwo o zupełnie innym charakterze. W aromacie na pierwszym miejscu są cytrusy, na drugim natomiast czekolada i nuty palone. Przebija się też nuta mleczna, toffie. Prezentuje się pięknie, duża czapa śnieżnobiałej piany na ciemnym, prawie czarnym piwie, nie wiem jak oni to zrobili że nie jest beżowa. W smaku pierwsze odczucie to typowa porterowa paloność i czekolada, sprawia wrażenie gładkiego, by po chwili uderzyła cytrusowa goryczka, na konkretnym poziomie. Wysycenie nie za wysokie. Bardzo ciekawe piwo o wyjątkowym, agresywnie chmielowym charakterze, przeciwieństwo stonowskego RISa i dowód że inne podejście do mocnego ciemnego piwa może być równie dobre.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, liquorice, roasted malt, some hops.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice, some coffee.

Bottle sharing w Multi Qlti. 
Piana szybko opada. Aromat palony, dość wyraźnie chmielowy, lekko drewniany. W smaku dość wytrawne, choć może tylko sprawia takie wrażenie, przez mocną goryczkę. Palone, likierowe. Wędzonka praktycznie niewyczuwalna, może minimalnie na posmaku, ale i tak chowa się pod goryczką. Jest okej.
Bottle. Dark brown with a light beige head. Loads if pine in the aroma, some slight smoked malts, chocolate. Very bitter on the tongue, complex, with a long bitter finish. Nice one

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Dark brown. Small, brown head. A malt heavy beer. Burnt caramel, some alcohol, burnt candi sugar and bitter chocolate flavour. Sweet and bitter. Medium to thick, oily body. Soft carbonation. Good!
Beautiful robust coffee aroma with hints of smoke and vanilla. Taste: Dark chocolate, oak wood and dark cherries. Well balanced between hops and malt.

Bottled 4/6/16. Great googily moogily, what a porter. Aromas pretty much perfect, giving up massive chocolate and coffee notes backed by a hoppy pine undertone and waves of smoke. Looks just as good, dark, dark brown with a jubilant beige head and lace upon lace. Taste starts with a heavy mocha vibe, then gains a caramel-toffee sweetness backed by dried cherry against an oaked vanilla background. Gains a considerable hop bitterness as it progresses, pine-filled and clingy, before hitting a chocolate-java finish touched with hints of smoke and wood. Textures milky smooth without a hint of alcohol. Absolutely delicious.

#1282Tap. Very dark red to black, small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruits, wooden barrel. Taste is strongly bitter, dry. Wood, barrel, alcohol, plums, cocoa. Full body, rich cocoa aftertaste, moderately carbonated. Very good heavy dry porter.

0,65 l bottle 
roasty, coffee, toast, vanilla, dark Brown / almost black Color, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Draught at BeerGeek Bar. Cloudy, dark red/brown colored. AROMA- roasted malts, wood, alcohol. FLAVOR- a bit sweet, pleasantly bitter., warming alcohol, roasted malts, wood. Fuller bodied. Great porter in American style.

Draught at 3 små rum, Göteborg, on March 30, 2017.AS "6th Anniversary Porter", likely Berlin brewed.Clear black color, dark reddish brown in it as well. Big tan head. Sweet, roasted scent. A bit metallic aftertaste first, then roasted, hoppy, bitter taste. Roasted aftertaste. Mineral on the tongue. Bit smooth mouthfeel, a bit fizzy CO2, medium high bitterness.

Dark red-brown color, beige head. Roasted malt nose, coffee, dried fruit, licorice, caramel, hint of yeast. Roasted malt taste, anise, brown sugar, wood, bitter coffee finish. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.
Fra flaske på Humle & Bier 17 Mar 17. Svart. Lavt mokkafarget skum. Aroma av lakris. Smaken tørr. Mest lakris. Syrlig ettersmak.
Bold and black, strong and full bodied, malty, slightly fruity, notes of hops, coffee, maybe some pine. Bottle from my cellar, an excellent porter in every way.

Poured from a big bottle at Humle & Bier - Craft Beer Festival. Dissipating espresso head, fair lacing, deep black body. Attractive aromas of pine and dark malts with a touch of coffee. Comprehensive, nicely roasted flavours of coffee, black chocolate, and dried fruits. Long-lived roasted malty bitter ending. Well bodied. Enjoying stuff (Shared with Finn, Tromsø 17.03.2017).
Fat hos Reza. Torr, rökig . Wasa skeppet här . Lång eftersmak. Spännande god rökig öl. Lite för hårt kolsyrad dock.

Bottle picked up by blonderedhead and shared for Valentines Day. Consumed in Avery Belgian snifter glass. Plenty of frothy tan head sits atop a dark black colored affair. Nose is an assertive roasted, nutty quality with a prevailing coffee undertone. Slight hint of chocolate...very mild. Taste carries the coffee elements through from the aroma with a bitter and roasted espresso bean finish. There is a kind of dark fruit (raisin) characteristic but its overshadowed by a overt bitterness. Dark chocolate towards the end. Seems to respond well to warming up. I can respect this one but the smoky qualities are not inspiring me to go out and buy it again.

Taste: Bold hoppy bites mixes with dark malts with berries, chocolate, toffee, oak, smokey notes. Same with the nose. Dark brown, semi opaque, tan foamy head. Full body. Smokey massive somewhat smooth porter, still hop presence.
Bottle. This is a smoke bomb of a porter with loads of roasted malts and coffee undertones.

Black as the deepest dungeon, and a fine tan head. Good lacing also. Fine intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a smooth fine carbonation level. Mellow and fine sweetness, and fine bitterness to back it up. Chocolate, roasted barley, mild smoke and espresso in the flavor. Solid nice evening sipper.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]
Bold & roasty! Lovely dark pour w/ a tiny head & great lacing. Aroma is dark coffee & powerful! The taste is bitter coffee w/ just enough hint of chocolate to smooth it out. Powerful stuff!

Bottle at home. Pours black with a fine sheet of white head. Aroma is of dark malts, dark chocolate, cherries, caramel, oak, some smoke, vanilla. Maybe some plums. Medium body. Flavour is rather rough, leathery, oaky, a little smokey, very bitter, dark chocolate, hoppy and intense. Finish is long and intense, too bitter and leathery. Overrated and overpriced, far too rough in my opinion.
Sample ar brewery. Dark with oatmeal head. Smoked sausage, but I get a little band aid. Flavor is like smoked sausage too.
@ Budapest. Black with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, ash, chocolate and some hints of ham. The body was medium and the finish rather bitter.
Bottle from Pivný Raj. Dark ruby/brown colour. Beige head. Aroma is intense, smoke, peat, hops, caramel. Taste is roasted, peat, hops. Very high bitterness. Good.
Bottle at a tasting. Intense and complex. Roasty, smoky, peaty. Bitter. ABV hidden well. Easy drinking and very tasty. Well balanced. Great.
Bottle kindly shared by rusos, many thanks. Dark brown color with small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, smoke, chocolate. Taste, peated malt, roastiness, chocolate, alcohol. Very good.

Fľaa by rusos. Tmavo jantárová farba, hnedá slabá pena. Vôňa karamel, praené slady, jemne údené slady. Chuť praené slady, jemne rauchové tóny, troku raeliny, alkohol. Červené prezreté ovocie. Alkohol v pozadí jemne vykúka. Príjemné pitie.

Bottle shared at Bratislava tasting 01/2017, shared by Rusos, thanks. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma is smoked, chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt. Taste is smoked, ham, medium bitter, dark chocolate, really hoppy finish.

Roasted Malty smell...too Light in smell though...Super dark appearance...Taste is somewhat bitter with coffee....At flying saucer with John after inakaya with Nora, Ashley and Megan... after new years 16-17
Pours very deep red brown with a light tan head. Roasty molasses and honey aroma. Roasty molasses cocoa flavor with some definite hops. Better once I really start to notice the hops.

Bomber from web SB cons 2016-12-28 Göteborg 
AR: hard roasted malt, dark chocolate 
AP: dark brown, wee brown foam
F: hard roasted, dark chocolate, dry, liqurice, wee vanilla, warming feeling,
Svart öl med ett mörkbeige skum. Doft av rostad malt, choklad och lättare asktoner. I smaken tillkommer karamell, lätt kryddighet och kakao.

Flaska. Svart öl med ett beigt skum. Dofter av kaffe, aska, lakrits och rostad malt. Smakinslag av kaffe, lakrits, torkad frukt, rök och karamell. Härligt sammansatt till en mycket drickbar och njutbar enhet. Lätt sälta i avslutningen.

Tack Daniel! Flaska från SB. En söt porter med så mycket karaktär. Aningen rökig som ger en lätt kärvhet, värme från alkoholen, chokladig maltighet, lätt ekkaraktär med lite vanilj och på det en hel del humle med tydlig men mjuk och rund beska. Allt i snygg harmoni och inte tungt någonstans. Riktigt riktigt gott.

This promised a lot, but only delivered some of it - there are some lovely coffee and bitter chocolate notes, and there is a lingering bitterness from the hops...but it is a bit thin and fizzy, and I'm not getting any of the fruit/vanilla flavours mentioned or the usual soft mouthfeel from wood ageing. Still a really good stout, just not world class
Pours pitch black with a dense, creamy and tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, breadish. Dry, roasted, alcohol and dark roasted malty. Bitter, dry and slight herbal. Dark roasted far finish.

Flaska från SB. En söt porter med så mycket karaktär. Aningen rökig som ger en lätt kärvhet, värme från alkoholen, chokladig maltighet, lätt ekkaraktär med lite vanilj och på det en hel del humle med tydlig men mjuk och rund beska. Allt i snygg harmoni och inte tungt någonstans. Riktigt riktigt gott.

Riktigt mörk brun, nästan helt ogenomskinlig, fast skum av små ljusa khaki bubblor. Doft: Kola, rostat, svagt sött kaffe, kanderade mandlar, vanilj, rök, svagt av övermogen frukt. Smak: Hårt rökt korv, kakao, svag söt lakrits, söt kaffesump, gräddkola, växt beska, vanilj.
660ml bottle from Doghouse. Almost black, not much head. Fancy bottle. Chocolate malt aroma. Sweet fishy flavour. Hoppy spicy aftertaste. Quality even though it is not my sort of beer.

Bomber into tulip glass, opaque deep brown (black) with darker tan head. Aroma notes of citrus/grass hops, smoke, roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruitiness. Taste adds coffee, licorice, mineral, vanilla, wood char, brown sugar, dark chocolate, some nuttiness and pine hop bitterness. Medium-heavy body, moderate-low carbonation, tad chalky, dry with lingering earthy bitter roast finish. A hoppy porter with some smoke influence, very nice.

08.12.2016, tap @ Café Sara:
Nice fizzy-creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish roasted, grass, weeds, sour-ish roasted grain, hops, minerals, bark, sour coffee, alcohol, dark sugar. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish roasted, minerals, weeds, bark, alcohol, grass, burnt grain, paper, sour coffee, harsh hops. Longlasting bitterness, harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.

Nästan svart med beiget skum. I doften finns mycket kaffe och lakrits. Smaken domineras av kaffe och stark lakrits, här finns en rejäl beska som dominerar. Nja, inte helt övertygad, jag tycker att det blev så mycket beska att själva portern försvann.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of fresh hops, oak, smoke, licorice and coffee. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of smoke, coffee, licorice and bitter chocolate. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

Bottle pour into pint glass. Appearance is dark brown with finger-width light brown foamy head, with poor retention and decent lacing. Aroma is smoky, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is dark fruit, chocolate, coffee, smoke. Palate is medium bodied with smooth, creamy texture, average-to-lively carbonation with mixed roasted and sweet and bitter malts, dry and crisp. Overall, the smoke is a nice change of pace.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a 20th Anniversary Encore Series: Stone 6th Anniversary Porter by Stone Brewing at JabeerwockyDeska. Malo wedxonki o dziwo. Kawa. Lekko. Niestety czuc alko mocno. Ale najsOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle at home. Pours opaque black with a large, frothy beige head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy roast and nutty malt, earthy and woody hops with prunes and leaves. Flavor is moderate roast and nutty malt, chocolate notes, prunes, earthy and woody hops and moderate bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Hoppy, citric, coffee, subtle smoke, salty licorice, woody, alcohol, soy sauce and undefined fruitiness.
Deep Brown colour, medium creamy beige head, lacing.
Salty, big bite, mid-sweet, soy sauce, coffee, grapefruit and dried berries in the taste, ABV very well integrated. Almost like a black IPA in the taste.
Medium/fullbodied, creamy feel, bitter, roasty and oaky finish.
Lovely brew.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a beige head; roasted malt aroma with chocolate, coffee, with hints of smoke, molasses, and wood; taste is slightly bitter with roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee with some vanilla, wood, and smoke; finish is light bitter and dry with some more roasted malt; very good
Fruity aroma. Fruity and bitter taste. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Really good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Draught at the Artturi, Tampere, Finland.
Black color with a mid-size foamy off-white head.
Dark berries, berry juice, darkness, licorice and mild sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavor is roasted malt, bitterness, dryness and salty licorice. Balanced. But somehow I'm not impressed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(Bottle) clear, bright, dark brown colour with a tall, brown head; aroma of smoke, roast, smoked fruit; creamy palate; rich, balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

Bomber from Beer Run, 7/20/16. Dark brown, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, mild cherries. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, nuts, pine, mild cherries, hints of smoke. Thin bodied, smooth, lingering bitterness.
Bottled:Pours black with ruby edges. Frothy head.Roasted aroma with notes of coffee, chocolate, hops and some smoked meat.Really bitter flavor with notes of hops, chocolate, coffee and some smoke.
65 cl bomber. Pitch black, beige browning head. Cofffe, dark cherryish fruit, chocolate, roasted malts, smokiness in aroma. Smokey berries, bitter and dry.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, ash, chocolate and some hints of ham. The body was medium and the finish rather bitter.

Tap @ Artturi.
Pours dark red-brown color with a small off-white head. Licorice on the nose, roast, some faint minty notes, hoppy, malt and subtle cocoa, coffee on the background, cant really locate the smoky notes. Flavor is spicy and roasted malty, licorice with some orange notes, cocoa, strong hops, coffee bitterness. Mild berry notes on the aftertaste, wooden dryness. Interesting but feels a bit harsh.
4424
Overall: Sweet syrup, dark fruits, some bitter chocolate. Toast.Note: Bottle 650 ml at home. Reviewed 2016-10-31.
Totalnie przegięta goryczka w stylu Arrogant Bastard nie pozwala mi się cieszyć tym piwem. A szkoda, bo aromat jest niezły, palony i dymny. Dębu tu nie znajduję.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Pitch black with a thick and foamy light brown head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is roasted and smoked malt. Good and balanced taste ending with a strong dark chocolate biterness. Average carbonation and medium body. Good stuff!

Aroma is roasted malts with light spiceyness and that pinch of smoked malts. Taste is coffee powder, a somewhat earthy character and a pinch of black peppercorns. Its a quite dry and herbal porter this, and with that light smokey character it feels a bit like chewing on an old wooden log from the fireplace. Yeah, I know, -"Dont drink smokey beers if you dont like it you retard", but sometimes you gotta go for it. Overall it turned out to be a really dry porter, that kind of turned it into a foreign stout or something in that region.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt brun med fluffigt ljusbrunt skum. Doft av fat, torkad frukt och choklad. Beskan från humlen slår igenom. Lätt kropp med lite kola.

Brown color, huge brown head. Sweet and nuanced aromas of chocolate, vanilla, toffee, caramel and smoked meat. Smoked taste with medium roasted flavors, slight hop with a bitter, earthy finish. I prefer the aromas over the taste.
@ Stordirren 16-10-31: ganska svag doft och smak med toner av skinka och aska. Ganska fyllig vätska med en lite bitter eftersmak.

Clear, brown beer with a huge, four finger high, beige head that leaves a lot of lacing on the Spigelau Stout glass. 

Nose: Caramel malt, fudge, cookie dough, vanilla, brown sugar, whipped cream, oak, charcuterie and smoke. 
Taste: Soft taste of caramel, dried fruit, grapefruit, brown sugar, roasted malt, oak, ash, smoke and fudge. 
Mouth: Full body. Light carbonation. Smooth texture. Bitter and dry ending. The bitterness grows back on my tongue long after the beer has gone down my throat. 

Of course Stone has done it again! A solid, great beer with a beautiful soul.

Flaska från SB. Mörk kolabrun/svart med fingerhögt beiget skum som ligger kvar som en tunn hinna. Rostade toner i doften med mycket kaffe, chark, rökiga toner, toffee, laktos och en gräddig ton. Ganska stor och fyllig kropp. Väl avvägt mellan en lite silkeslen känsla och mer stickig. Välhumlad, nästan mer åt en svart-IPA i smaken. Hårt rostade, brända toner, toffee, lite choklad och kaffe längre bak. Laktos och grädde här med. Fint rökiga toner. Riktigt bra.

Malty licorice aroma in a brown black pour. No licorice in the taste - which is good thing in my book. Otherwise pretty stock standard in the hop malt balance - but damn impressive given the strength.

650ml bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a large, creamy beige head, good lacing. Roasted, woody, chalky and slightly smoky aroma, ash, peat, chocolate and citrus hops, lovely! Medium-bodied, soft carbonated, chalky and smooth mouthfeel. The taste is like the aroma and much more like a BIPA, still very pleasant. Roasted and fruity, coffee, roasted barley, peat, smoked ham, citrus zest and grass. A hoppy kick in the mouth along with the roasted malt that just blend so well. Chalky and citrus fruity finish. Easy to drink, great stuff!
From a 22 oz. bottle shared at home. Pours a clear deep cola brown with a tan head, Aroma of chocolate and leather. Flavors of tobacco and charred wood. Bitter roast finish.

A dark feast. Pours really dark brown with firm chocolate head and a small but sweetish nose. Tones of coffee and chocolate present. Taste is bitter with lots of hops to accompany chocolate notes and some red fruits. Oak is also in the palate. Great porter.

On tap at the Brass Rail in OFallon, Mo. IT poured a dark brown color with an off- white head. The aroma was of smoke, roasted malts and light caramel. The taste was similar to the aroma with more smoke, roasted malts, caramel, licorice, bitter hops and some alcohol. It was medium bodied with soft carbonation. Really good.
Woody aroma, hints of smoke. Wood in the taste as well together with some roastiness and maltiness. Big bitter finish. Creamy smooth texture.

Poured from 22 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, but clear around the edges, mahogany with a 2-finger khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of smokey malt, roasted coffee, caramel, roasted malt and a little chocolate. 

Taste of heavily roasted bitter coffee, chocolate, smokey roasted malt, dark fruit and caramel. 

Medium body and medium carbonation. 

There is no ash tray smokiness here. It's more of the peaty-style smokiness. Although, I wouldn't describe the taste as peaty. Nice balance of bitter, smokey and malty flavors.





---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark pour with a firm and lingering tan head. A blanket of light smoke covers a roasted malt and pine hop filled Porter. Some chocolate and earthy notes round it out. Medium bodied. Almost a black IPA but they showed just enough restraint to keep it drinkable. Quite nice.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Taste is mild sweet followed by a roasty bitter finish. Medium bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.

19-OCT-2016, draft @Taphouse.
Brown with a tan head.
Very bitter, roasted, burnt, touch of smoke, caramel, spice, coffee. Lively carbonation, bitter, burnt roasted finish.

Hoppy with toast and roasty malts. Very bitter both hoppy and of a coffee kind of bitterness. Huge chunky beer. Tons of hops big heavy beer. Classic hop forward Stone beer. Minimal chocolate in the finish mostly bitter resin and piney hops. Filling and tasty but I miss the malt taste, this is more like a black ipa than porter to me.

Bottle from Sprouts: So I remember tasting this beer 5 or 6 years after it had been bottled and I always considered myself so lucky to have tasted this beer even if it had years of aging. Kind of sucks how Ratebeer deleted my rating when they changed the database alias to this new beer. Aroma is mild with an undeniable scent of coffee bean and chocolate but I also pick up a whiff of whoppers chocolate malt balls. The flavor is initially bitter and I was not sure if it was from acidic hops or roasted malts that bring about flavors of bitter coffee or chocolate, however, the sprinkle of sweetness round out the robustness of this rich porter. Happy to re-visit this Anniversary ale with a fresh bottle because this beer definitely tasted better fresh, so thanks Stone!

Tap at Sedona. Chocolate licorice aroma. Flavor is heavy chocolate, light smoke, bottom of the pot coffee. Quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BOTTLE. (BO041216). Dark pour with big fluffy cola head.. Big malty nose with dark choc & pepper qualities.. Solid dark toasty malt body, some coconut, dark chocolate bitter finish.. Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel
Black with two fingers of dark tan head. Aroma is a bit smokey with dark roasted malts. Taste is roasty, earthy, and woody with a little black coffee bitterness. Heavy bodied and fairly thick.
On tap. Black with creamy beige head. Roasted malt aroma,chocolate, licorice, alcohol. Sweet malt flavour, chocolate, roasted, alcohol. Roasted finish
Bottle. Black pour, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, caramel, burnt malts and bready yeast. Flavor is quite bitter, roasted, creamy, slightly sweet and very full bodied. Heavy brew.

Bottle from beer junction. Nice hazelnut and chocolate flavors. Little bit of smoke and a little bit of hops. Quite nice. Could drink a lot of this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, roasted nuts, slight vanilla, brown sugar. Taste is roasted and chocolatey with a very nice balanced bitterness. Mouthfeel is quite light bodied with medium carbonation

Sampled from tap at Stone Garden Berlin. Black color with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, soy sauce, umami,
dark fruits, a bit cherry. Taste is chocolate, a bit wood and ash, again a bit soy sauce and some dark fruits.
Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Not bad, but a bit underwhelming.

Draft @ Taphouse, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate caramel flavor with weak smoky hints. Has a roasted malty smoky chocolate caramel finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, chocolate, bitternes, bread, alcohol and dried fruit.
Bottle shared at hopaholic. Pitch black colour, small white head. Nose is soy sauce with nuts. Taste is medium bitterness. Expected better.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Fruity and malty smell with dark malts, chocolate, sugar and syrup. Similar taste with some dried herbs. Sharp and strong bitterness, too strong to be honest.

Pours black with creamy beige head... Aroma of smoked malts, chocolate, oak... Flavor is smoked malts, maybe some rye, lots of peppery spicy woody notes throughout, chocolate bitterness... Really nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with a big fluffy, tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa powder and smoke. A very very smokey beer, like a proper Isle of Skye whisky which is great cause I love them. Really smooth.
Keg at BrewDog Birmingham; opaque black pour with a bubbly love guy beige head, aroma has dark fruits and chocolate, taste has dark berries, a hint of smoke, coffee and dark bitter chocolate.
Bottle for $4.99 from Bottles N Bins in Monterey, CA. Dark brown pour. Aroma of dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, cocoa and coffee. Flavor is the same.
Pours cola brown with aroma of roasted malt, smoke, dark fruit and wood. Roasted malt flavor with smoke, cherry, dark chocolate, and wood. Very nice beer!

Bomber from A.J.s Food Mart in Soquel. Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma of smoke, medium dark fruit, some treacle, and chocolate. Med body or so. Flavor is smoky, chocolate, toffee and fruits.. But smoke is the major flavor contributor. With time berry is noticeable. Smoked berry? Weird, but nice. Good stuff.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo webshop. Earlsdon, Coventry on the Stena Hollandica en route to Hoek of Holland, Thursday 22nd September 2016   Dark chestnut in colour but with a ruby hue, a small light beige head sits atop. Quite a hoppy burst but with an underlying softness and smokey edge. Some bitter chocolate and coffee but green hops come through, I have to say I find the bitterness a bit rough and its a little unbalanced. Maybe I will like it a bit more as I get through this. A6 A4 T7 P4 OV13 3.4

Pours black with a small head.
Nose shows roasted malt and cocoa, nutty malt and soft liquorice.
Flavours include more roasted malt, soft booze and heavy cocoa.

Unaged. Big brown American bottle. Pours dark brown with a ruby hue. Thick tan foam, uneven, subsiding slowly. Scent is medium caramel Porter. Little chemical soapy. Taste is medium caramel and a bit early hops. Quite mature combination despite simple hop body. Vanilla. Excellent.
Delicious porter with chocolate notes in the taste and aroma. Would definitely seek this out.

22oz bottle 9/15/16 (Binnys Downers Grove)-42° in shaker-Pours black with a small loose tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, chocolate, and slight smoke. Taste of the same with more coffee, and smoke on the back end. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and hits the spot on a cool evening.

Dark cola colored with thin tan head. 
Straw, chalk, hay, chocolate, vanilla, and butterscotch aromas. 
Malty sweetness throughout with slight bitter and sour notes on the finish. 
Chocolate, coffee, cola, and floral flavors. 
Very drinkable, fairly high ABV porter. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not bad at all. Its got a delicious smokiness, a bit toasty on the back of the throat. Great Anniversary beer!!

Smoked oak aroma, floral. Deep mud color with tan head. Medium to thin body, carbonation on the tongue. Biscuit, malt, toffee, and coffee flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich super deep dark brown body, about 90% opaque with almost no head at all! Aroma of very strong and assertive bread, yeast, malt, nuts and coffee. Medium to Full-bodied; very strong malty and pungent bitterness from the grain, roast and the coffee with a noticeable and not very pleasant alcohol burn showing bread and unfinished yeast as well. Aftertaste is reply bittered as well with earth, grain and that yeast really coming out and not in a good way! Overall, very disappointing with a very bitter flavour throughout and almost nothing pleasant. Im glad I had this on tap and just 10oz. Another huge letdown from Stone - if you took off the label on the front, this score would drop 30 points! I sampled this 10oz snifter on draught from Whole Foods in Pentagon City, Virginia (Arlington) at the end of my driveway on 07-September-2016 for US$5,00.
Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens  Berlin, today. Smooth as can be, and quite subtle. Cumulative flavours become tasty roasted malt. Glad for the encore!

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Black colour with a tan head. Roasted and fruity aroma. Roasted malty bitter taste and finish. Thick body.

Si ya de por si la smoked porter es buena, esta es genial.
Notas ahumadas, café, chocolate y maltas tostadas.

Bottle. The look is dark, brownish black in color. The smell is roasty, malt, burnt, coffee, prunes, and rasian. The taste is much the same, really roasty burnt.
22 oz bottle. Deep brown with a decent beige head. Aroma and is of cocoa, roasted malts, light smoke, and coffee. Taste is of dark chocolate, smoke, light ash, and cocoa.

Tall bottle shared at Jeds, it poured a near-opaque dark brown, beige foam. Malty, toasty, roasty, less hoppy than most Stone brews. Bitterness seems derived as much from roasted barley as from hops. Some tangy ripe apricots, black cherry, plum, chocolate, coffee. Not quite burnt but close. Medium body, fairly dry finish. Great stuff.

From draft at haket gothenburg, poured deep dark Brown in colour with a off tanned head. Nose of sweet caramel malts, light toasted, mocha, dark sweet chocolate, vanilla oak, cacao, dark forrest fruits, sweet cherries, tobacco and light smoke. Very Nice porter
UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 On tap @ Haket Pub. Dark reddish brown with a small off white head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, coffee and hops. Medium to full body with a long bitter finish.
Draught at Haket, Göteborg. Black beer with a nice beige head. Hoppy chocolate aroma, citrus, hay, fruity, licorice notes. Hoppy flavor, chocolate and licorice, caramel, slightly grassy. Really nice.

Draught at Bishops Arms Savoy.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, dried fruits and licorice.
Roasted flavour of caramel, dried fruits and chocolate.
Roasted finish.

650ml bottle. Pours a clear red-brown with a huge, long lasting, creamy, tan head that leaves plenty of lace. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and cherry. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, licorice, peat, oak, toffee and coffee with a hint of grapefruit in a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Weird... very hoppy for a porter... but also very enjoyable.

Black with a tall, light beige head. Aroma is smoky, dark roast coffee, and a hint of dark chocolate. Rich smoky flavor, some vanilla, finish of dark coffee. Smooth and creamy feel lingers. Very nice.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a dense, creamy and tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, breadish. Dry, roasted, alcohol and dark roasted malty. Bitter, dry and slight herbal. Dark roasted far finish.

Pours semi-opaque cola-brown with a tight, 3-finger tan head. Mild aroma of vanilla and wood, mixed with a note of coffee. Maybe some cherry as well. Body is medium-to-full and lightly oily. Mildly dry finish. Flavor is nutty, with some char to it, and a note of berry at the back. A touch of citrus and maybe some vanilla as it warms.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Roasted and moderate smoked malts, some chocolate sweetness, and lingering charred bitterness. Fine.
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black, nose is coffee, chocolate, light fruit, taste is dry, roasted, chocolate, bitter, sweet.

22 ounce bottle poured to tulip	
Appearance: Very dark brown/black, medium tan foam that slowly disappears, some lacing	
Aroma: Nose: not a lot, nutty on the drink, strong smell of alcohol	
Taste: bitter for a porter, long bitter follow through	
Feel: creamy	
Overall: Very good beer, ok to repeat but not to look for
Drank 8/8/2016 10:00 pm

Tap at Hair of the Dog, Bangkok. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy off white head. The aroma is light smoke, roasty malt, light caramel. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter with a big hop bitter, liqourice, light smooth alcohol, light dry coffee, spicy smoke palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Amazing.

Bottle. Cola, chocolate malt. ash and hay aroma. Black with small head. Mildly sweet lightly earthy/smoky chocolate malt and moderately bitter ash and herbal hay flavor. Good body - a bit lighter than expected. Very nice.

Éjfekete színben érkezik, bézs színű habot fejleszt, imperial porterektől nem éppen szokatlan módon marcipános, étcsokoládés, tejszínes illatokkal operál, krémesen édes, konyakosan-likőrösen alkoholos aromákat áraszt. Tejszerű, sima és lágy zamatai érett jegyeket rejtenek, fahordós, vaníliás, kissé pörkölt, pisztáciás karakter bújik meg a krémes, közepes teltségű szerkezetben. Az alkoholfok már nem ennyire észrevétlen, noha nem a legdurvább mérték, amelyhez valaha szerencsém volt. Összességében azonban remek főzet, bár nem a vérmesebb imperial porterek közül való.
An intensely hoppy dark malt beer, more black IPA than imperial porter but perhaps with some age the malt would come through more clearly. Still very good stuff.
The quintessential I imperial porter.so unbelievably smooth. No sign of alcohol. Yet rich.
Much like a Black IPA in some ways, this is very straightforward. Not a lot of complex malt character considering the style, but a well made beer, as expected from Stone.

22 Oz bottle from Spirits Jackson. Poured a medium to fuller density with a huge foamy beige head. Aroma is chocolatey, super old coffee with creamer, wet toast, hint of sugar. Flavor is better than the aroma loads of dusty chocolate, creamer, coffee, earthy, slight soy and cola.

This cool 22oz encore bomber pours with a deep mahogany colored body that supports a thin tan head of foam. The aroma offers up roasty malts, a bit of burnt malts, some molasses like sweetness and then a faint dark fruity ester sensation. The taste is nice and bold and integrated with roasty malts, burnt malts, chocolate malts, a woody spicy maltiness and then this gets sweetened up some by a malty slightly molasses like sweetness. This has firm malt roastiness and then toward the finish picks up slivers of sweet dark fruity esters to add just that little extra something. A few more sips and it feels like theres a faint sense of smokiness going on as well. Solid robust porter. So glad it was brewed again.

På fat Bishops Malmö. Doften lovar mycket. Här ligger tångruskorna täta. Finns toner av vanilj samt inslag av läder o lakrits. Smaken är tyvärr något för söt o eftersmaken är för mycket sötlakrits. Hyfsad!!
Does not at all drink like an "intensified version of Stone Smoked Porter". Its tasty but the additional flavors dont add to the originals terrific smokiness, they mask it.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours black with a long-lasting beige head. Aromas of chocolate, light smoke, roast. Taste is more dark chocolate, roast, molasses. Light sweet finish.

Draft at SB. Imperial Porter rating #100 (until they arbitrarily re-classify another one, which is bound to happen...) and its hard to imagine a better choice for a milestone rate within the style. Was always a classic. Pours an opaque matte black with a dense and creamy tan head that sticks around pretty much for the duration. Big dark chocolate, campfire, roast, toasty black bread crust, and coffee nose. Pretty much all the goodness you would expect from a rich thick dark beer with a heavy malt base. Creamy thick body with moderate soft carb. Roasty, chocolatey, coffee-ish mid palate with hints of campfire. Beautiful balance of sweet, smoky, dry, roasty, and accenting characteristics. Great stuff.
Keg at brew dog Edinburgh... Dark black.. Thick tan head... Dry chocolate roast malts nose... Big dark chocolate.. Bitter roast

On tap at the Knick. Roast malted nose, with chocolate, coffee, and some licorice. Mild hop floral notes. Dark brown-black opaque with creamy light tan lacing head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts malty and rich but not overly sweet. Roasted toasted malt and grain, coffee and chocolate, mild vanilla and molasses. Big nutty bitter finish and diminishes into a mild roasty bitter after.

Pours medium brown with a big off white head. Nose is relatively restrained with oddly hoppy character for a porter, along with bits of coffee and oak. Flavor is a solid porter with barrel aging showing strongest on the back. Finish is somewhat sticky and lots of bourbon.

Bomber. Pours a ruby reddish black with a thick, creamy, resilient beige head. Aroma is chocolate, cherry, wood, smoke, vanilla. Flavor is chocolate, toffee, smoke, ash, dark cherry, field berries. Finish is smoke, loads of wood, dark coffee. Lingering wood and smoke. Medium body, velvety and oily mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation. A true masterpiece.

Pours a dark chestnut brown with a one-finger, rich, khaki colored head. Roasted malt nose. A bit nutty. Rich and bold, particularly for the style. Relatively, quite thick. Sweet up front, but burnt ends savoriness quickly dominates and lingers.
Pours a dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is bitter, burnt roast and chocolate. Flavor is similar. Has some carbonation, some bitterness, and a smooth body. Good.

Keg at brewdog Shepherd bush. An opaque black coloured pour with a steadfast creamy mid tan head. Aroma is mild roaat, choc, hints of red berries and some alcohol on the nose. Flavour is composed of bitter dark choc, burnt roast, rubber, vanilla cream. Harsh butter acrid roast in the finish. Palate is medium full bodied, medium sweet, bitter finish. Slightly creamy in the mouth. Nice red berries on the flavour as well. Big lingering bitter roast.

Rich chocolatey aromas, hints of wood, dark fruits and a touch of booze. Mid bodied porter with a initial carbonation bite. Flavor is bitter dark chocolate and coffee, the booze hides the oak and fruit but the hops make an appearence at the end. Overall i like it.
On tap at Caliente. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is cocoa and oak. Medium body, bitter roast, oak, dark chocolate, dry finish, good.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, bitter coffee, and lots of bitterness.

2500th rating! Woohoo! bottle from Specs. Pours very dark brown, almost black, with a beige head. Aroma of cocoa, smoke, ash, vanilla, and faint fruit. Taste is rich and smokey, woody, and quite bitter and ashy. Body full and smooth; finish long and bitter. Very nice.

Keg at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, London. A black coloured pour with a healthy frothy beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, chocolate, slightly smoky, some coffee but really quite bitter, this is still decent but the bitterness spoils it.

Bottle. Pours brown in color, with a creamy to frothy, beige, fully-lasting head that leaved great lacing. Aroma of dark roasted malts and earthy leaves like the basement windows I was cleaning out today. Medium to heavy bitter, a bit too much carbonation (bottle overflowed upon opening), lightly sweet but completely overpowered by the bitter, full body, somewhat sticky in my mouth, subtle flavors of vanilla and caramel, leading to a slightly sticky, medium-bitter finish.

Poured from a 22 Oz bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a pitch black presentation with a tan colored head. The aroma was chocolate, malt and coffee. The taste was a smooth rendition of the aroma. An outstanding beer.

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, full frothy head. Sweet malt aroma. Medium body with sweet malt flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle. Dark black, great lacing, well sustained-head. Chocolate aroma, creamy consistency, tart with coffee notes. Good beer.
Aroma reminiscent of an IPA hoppy with a hint of smoke. Pours a dark black color with a thin head. A taste of smoke and hops with a medium body and a bitter hops finish.

22 ounce bottle - $7.99 at Bullocks Wine & Spirits in Marietta, Georgia.

Bottled on: 04/11/16.

Appearance: Slips out a very dark brown body capped with an airy-looking, two inch-high layer of tan-hued foam.

Smell: A hoppy vibe of curt citrus and slackened resins atop the subtly smoke of the ashen, blackened malt.

Taste: Espresso edged malty roastiness with a light acrid, slightly astringent soot element. Minor dark fruitiness. Its firmly hoppy, playing up tastes of grapefruit and resins, overshadowing the malts, but, given the seemingly harsh roastiness of it, perhaps thats just as well. Moderately bitter. Earthy, dry undercurrent of oak wood. Hops remain abundant into the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.

Overall: Wasnt a fan.

Pours a dark brown with a huge foamy tan head. Light aroma of roasted malts. Roasted malts flavor and a tad bitter. Flavor isnt as bold as I expected. Also not as rich and creamy as it looks. Still pretty enjoyable.

Keg at BD Soho. It pours jet black with a sturdy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, smoke, tobacco, peppery spice, chocolate cake, earth, mocha coffee and a touch of vanilla toffee. The taste is rather bitter upfront, rich roasted malt, charred wood, cacao nibs, resin, coffee grounds, some dull smoke, tobacco, spice and some dark plummy fruit in the background. The finish is dry and bitter and lingers like a bastard. Full body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Perhaps a bit too full-on even, but its good fun and challenging to drink.
Half. Brewdog. Licorice, smoke, bitterness. Really good stuff. Doesnt smell too intense but tastes great.

A very good beer overall. Pours a beautiful deep ball with a white head. Smells of vanilla, chocolate and mint. Taste is thick and smooth, with vanilla, followed by chocolate and mint, and a hoppy finish. Had on tap at Bailey's Taproom.

On tap at BrewDog Shepherds Bush as Stone 6th Anniversary Porter. Black beer lasting tan head. Big dark chocolate aroma. Its a porter with chocolate then a bit thin as it goes on then a lot of dryness and bitterness. Not sure what to make of it. I like the aroma and mouthfeel amd the poise of the beer but its weird as well. Oily tarry. Too intense maybe. Too tight. It needs to relax. Finish lacks finesse.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co. and snifter served showing a black/brown hue with some amber highlighting, a presentable layer of tan head foam, and sheeting, wavy spray to the lacing. The nose was a roasted, mocha blend of coffee & cocoa, some hints of dark fruit, and decent maltiness. Medium bodied, with okay carbonation, the taste added a very pronounced, roasted, peppery, earthy, rind, & char-like bitterness that lingered past the finish. Too much bite, low drinkability, and difficult to finish.

On tap at Baileys, pours a deep dark reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma brings out a lot of tart vinous notes, a little perfume and some peated malt - strange nose. Flavour reveals a ton of peated malt upfront - mixed with the barrels, it gives off a weird perfumey, varnish-like quality which isnt pleasing. Some stale coffee grounds as well. Im surprised at the high ratings for this; either that, or this keg is off. Not a fan.

Keg at BD Sheps Bush, 27/06/16.
Light black with a decent beige cap.
Nose is roast malt, light spice, discernible hop presence, subtle smoke, charr.
Taste comprises light coffee grinds, earthy hop, cocoa powder, very light smoke, dark fruit rinds, toffee, pinch of black pepper.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. 
Decent porter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap at Stone in Asagaya (5th year anniversary event). Big milk chocolate forward nose with cacao nib, coffee and light smoke. Some light fruity sourness comes out as it warms. The smoke and chocolate work really well together. Creamy on the palate with some light oak notes. Finish is smooth and not overly bitter like a lot of Stone beers are. Great stuff.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer Gratz on beer 2112 Ala Rush black with a beige head. Aromas of coca smoky malt dark chocolate fig. Taste is dark chocolate burnt coffee dark fruit and a lingering bitterness.

This rate is dedicated to Rush. Number 2112. Encore! Bomber. Pours nearly black with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, fig, light smoke. Flavor is dark chocolate, overextracted coffee, oak, smoke. A bit too much bitterness in the finish for my taste.

APPEARANCE- very dark, when held up to the light, you can see its dark brown. Beige head with great lacing.
NOSE- slightly bitter, almost acrid when its cold. As it warms up, i smell more of the smokiness that its based on.
FLAVOR- Similar to the smell, slightly acrid - perhaps owing to the oak. Not much smokiness. Overall not what i expected.

Aroma has cocoa, smoky malt, caramel, semi-sweet chocolate covered cherries and a hint of alcohol, more and more comes out as the beer warms; near black color, opaque, large and lasting khaki-colored head; nice smoke and chocolate caramel malt, roasted malt and ash/charred wood, cocoa powder, robust overall; medium-full body, smooth and slightly creamy, enough carbonation to open up the flavor and keep it from feeling too heavy; very good, love the smokiness and wood flavors, doesnt drink like an 8%er, but sure feels like it later... 22 fl oz bottle from Binnys in Chicago, IL.

On tap at Champps in Brookfield. Really been looking forward to this - one of my favorite brewers making one of my favorite styles, so really pleased they re-released it. Pour is very dark brown with little head. Nose is tangy ashy with smoke. Taste better; ashy, chocolate, light smoke. Medium to full bodied, with alcohol. Blend is decent. Finishes well blended between bitter and sweet. Solid enough, but actually a disappointment. 13.8

A 22 fl oz bomber bottled on 3rd April 2016 and poured into a Moonzen teku glass. It poured a clear dark brown colour with a one finger tanned head good retention and moderate lacing. Aromas of toasted malts, cherry and vanilla with a hint of smoke and chocolate. Roasted malts and smoky char dominate taste with bittersweet chocolate in the background and a hint of vanilla. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall a pretty good Imperial Porter thats balanced and surprisingly easy to drink. Glad I got to try it.

Bomber. Deep brown with a reddish tint at the edge. A medium khaki head. Nose of cocoa and bits of cola. There is also some wood. Flavors of caramel and coffee are accented with barrel character. There is also some chocolate. Very smooth body with barely noticeable alcohol.

It pours a deep, dark brown with a brown head that is quite full. It has aromas of roast, nuts, plums, raisin, and smoke. The flavors and complex and quite full. There are smokey and nutty flavors with roasted malts. It also has dark fruit flavors of plum and some fruity hops. There are also hints of coffee. It has a full feel that is on the light side that is extremely smooth. Overall it is a very complex blend of malts and fruit flavors with smoke.

Bottle from CostCo of all places. 

A: Pitch black, cappuccino head, lacing. 

N: Peppercorn, coffee, earth, bakers chocolate, vanilla, roast, and burnt biscuit. Noticeable pine, some grapefruit from the hops, and an intense amount of wood. 

T: Quite bitter, very roasty, decently sweet.

M: Medium body, no alcohol, fizzy carbonation. 

O: Like a ramped up version of Black Butte Porter. Very spicy with an African coffee quality. But the oak detracts because theres too much of it.

Light cocoa, coffee, heavy pepper smell, look light is a dark, muddy black, taste is smokey, peppery, charcoal, bitter after the swallow, hint of sweetness. I wish it had a little more sweetness to mellow the strong pepper/bitter coffee notes. Good beer, but could use a little more ABV, would be much better at around 10 ABV.

Bottle from Albertsons. Just about the time I convince myself Im not that keen on porters, along comes a beauty like this to restore my faith in the style. Milky brown pour with creamy beige head. Aroma leads you into some roast malts, earthy, peaty scents. Taste kicks it up a notch, adding a nice sharp bitterness from the roast grains, with subtle hints of chocolate. Excellent mouthfeel and finish.

Bottle @ The Greenwald Residence. Thanks, Jake. Cola colored beer with a khaki head. Intense smoke and roasted malts. Kind of meaty, which is off-putting to me. At least some dark fruits like raisin, black cherry, and plum. Certainly some of those typical roasty notes, coffee, and dark chocolate as well. Actually comes off a little bit acidic as well. Just not a fan of this one.
Pours a medium cola brown with a foamy tan head. Smells of smoke, bread, dark fruit, floral hops. Taste is sweet at moderately bitter - smoky, oaky, cocoa

Bomber. Roasted malt aroma with chocolate, smoke, cherry, coffee and toffee. Pours dark brown with a large light brown head that has excellent retention and good lacing. Starts with roasted malt and chocolate flavors and has a rich body and smooth mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with toffee, coffee, cherry and nice smoke that lingers on the palate after. Nice, rich porter.

Bottle of the re-release picked up at Hop City Birmingham but enjoyed in TN. Dark brown pour with a big, foamy tan head. Dark malt and chocolate in the aroma with a faint whiff of hops. Big porter flavor of dark malt but also aggressively hopped. A fairly "American imperialized" take on a porter. Good and the hops mellow out into some rich milk chocolate as it warms.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A smooth, easy drinking porter. Medium to light mouthfeel, no alcohol detected, notes of mainly roasted malts with a little coffee. Didn't get much chocolate. An above average beer but they are better ones out there with more complexity (founders porter comes to mind). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours clear ruby black, medium creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is heavy roast, hardwood smoke, coffee, chocolate. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, lightly smoky, roasty, cocoa, hints of vanilla. Medium body, lingering bitterness. Solid Porter.

What a nice return. Bomber. Pours a dark brown color with a large beige head. A big sweet malty chocolate and mint nose. Creamy. The flavor is big bitter roast, chocolate, minerals, cherry. Awesome big beer. This is right down my alley.

Bottle - big dark tan thick head, very dark Amber/brown color, big roasty and chocolatey aroma and flavor, creamy finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At SAVOR 2016. Poured a dark ruby brown color with an off-white head. Aroma was some earthy notes, bakers chocolate, pine resin. A bit too roasty, bitter chocolate for my liking unfortunately, making this an interesting experience, but not something Id probably seek out again, Im glad theyre doing this series though, revisiting some old brews. Keep it up.

Bomber to tulip. Smoky malt with slight mint backing. A little peatty. Deep brownish red with light brown head that retains well. Taste is chocolate and moderate high smoke. Rich, well rounded mouthfeel.

Bottle from North End
Pours a clear dark brown with garnet at the edges and a creamy bubbly tan head that persists. Big hoppy nose filled with earth and pine. Light caramel and chocolate maltiness deep underneath, hints of smoke oak tannin and light vanilla round this out nicely.

Black pour under a thin foamy light khaki hued head. Earthy roasted black malt on the nose, and a smokey touch. Smokey flavor as well. Earthy smokey black malt, and a light earthy bitterness. Nothing much to love here, unless youre keen on very smokey and earthy dry, bitter porters.
Tap. Black with small head. Roasty dark chocolate, light coffee. A bit of dark fruit. Dry hoppy bitter finish.

Bottle shared by brother Murray. 

 Dark chestnut body with hints of crimson. Sticky tan lacing coats the glass. Aromas of bakers chocolate, earth, pine, resinous hops. Cocoa powder finishing with pine and bitter hops. Tasty.

Appearance: Deep chestnut body, like Coke, somewhat opaque, but light gets through the edges. Tall foamy tan head.
Aroma: Mild aroma of dark chocolate and char, light hops showing through, smells light pine. Very mild aroma.
Taste: Some smoke and char, light chocolate, hints of sweetness, finish is dry and of espresso beans.
Palate: Medium bodied, creamy foamy carb.
Overall: Just okay, I dunno, doesnt do much for me.

Pours a coffee black with a nice beige head. Smoke and roasted malts in the nose. Flavor is much of the same with a fair amount of smokiness coming through with a definite dark chocolate kick. It likes to stay on the tongue long after its down, but its nothing offensive. Exemplary offering from the Stoned ones.

Tap at j Ryans in Syracuse with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Black with medium off white head and excellent lacing. Roasty chocolate nose. Roasted malty taste, heavy booze, drying bite. Medium body, full flavor. Alcohol is dominant.
Aromas are very earthy, like tree bark. Black with a fairly lasting off-white head. Dry, earthy, bitterness is almost tannic feeling. Full bodied.
Pours a dark black with light brown. A smoky aroma, grain, and chocolate aroma. A strong smoky taste with chocolate and roasted malts. A lingering smoky aftertaste.

On tap at McGillicuddys, Williston, VT.
This was poured into a snifter.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a slim off white to tan foamy head that quickly dissipated. Light lacing.
The smell started off with some sweet meaty smokiness. Light roast. Edged with some sweet milk chocolate and some dark chocolate as well.
The taste was moderately sweet adding in a light dry woodiness, subtle vanilla, and roasted coffee beans. Semi-sweet to roasty aftertaste - nice. Moderately sweet and roasty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium in body with a fair sipping quality about it. Carbonation feels good for what it is - somewhat low which is good because the bitterness hits my tongue just as I had hoped it would.
Overall, fantastic Imperial Porter hitting all of the right spots. Would love to have again.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, mild smokey character, chocolate, earthy bitterness, hint of berries, this is a solid revisiting of what was a very good beer.

From the 650 ml. bottle. The pour is mostly dark brown with ruby red hues and a lovely, soft tan head. Thats 5 out of 5. The aroma has a nice dark roasted malt and chocolate character but there is something a little odd - like buttered corn. That was a slight letdown considering this gets a 100 on RB. The body is smooth and better than medium. The taste has a fascinating dark roasted malt note with a mild top moderate bitterness to finish. I did not get to try it when it first came out and it makes sense that they would bring it back. Too bad the aroma seemed off to me or I would have rated it even higher.

22 oz bottle shared, purchased at Bullfrog Wine & Spirits. Black appearance with lacy dark tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, bitter chocolate, piney hops, charred oak, light coffee and a hint of smoke. Similar flavor, quite roasty with medium to heavy bitterness. Medium body with a dry feel and a lingering bitter finish. It gets better as it warms, but its almost too bitter to enjoy.

Pours a near black with a khaki head. Chocolate, roasted malt, toffee, caramel, smoke, dark fruit and oak aroma. Dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasted malt, toffee, oak, dark fruit, resinous hop, licorice and smoke flavors. Medium full body with moderate carbonation. Chocolate, smoke and roasted malt finish.

Kind of a grainy smoky nose. Nice initially thick mouthfeel, very gritty. Taste is decent, palate and depth are great. It has plenty of chocolate malt, a bit of fruit, and smoke in the background. Pleased that the smoke does not dominate, just acts as a foil for the very sweet chocolate malt. Dry yet sweet finish. Those seem opposite. Clear brown orange appearance with spotty lacing. Well done.
Tap. Pours a translucent brown with a nice layer of beige head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts, coffee, some smokiness.
22 ounce bottle. Pours almost black with a decent tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, fruit, and smoke. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, berries, and some smoke. Nice.

Smoky for sure, as others have noticed, maybe too so. Pours a majestic black with finger of "looks nitro" head made from the tinniest of bubbles. Aroma is smoke. Expected, but he flavor is just too much of a single thing, some malt there making an appearance, but bitter/sour smokiness dominating. Finish is carried over and rough.

Bottle, black beer, big cream colored head, amazing lace. Aroma is chocolate, some metal, raisin and fig, dust, and flowers (really, I swear!). Taste is vanilla, coffee, citrus rind, sprucy hops (because this is stone), and bergamot (again?), hint of smoke. Palate is creamy, carbonation almost nitro.
Aromas of faintly citric hops and roasted malts. Taste is faint citric hops, charred malts, chocolate, and coffee.

22 ounce bottle into signature tulip glass, bottled on 4/6/2016. Pours very dark brown color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky kahki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood smoke, dark bread, toasted oak, nuttiness, caramel, toffee, light char/vanilla, grapefruit, orange peel, pine, raisin, plum, cherry, berry, herbal, floral, and roast/smokey earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/smoked malt, citrus/earthy hops, oak, and light-moderate fruity yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood smoke, dark bread, toasted oak, nuttiness, caramel, toffee, light char/vanilla, grapefruit, orange peel, pine, raisin, plum, cherry, berry, herbal, floral, and roast/smokey earthiness. Moderate amount of roast/char and pine hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood smoke, dark bread, toasted oak, nuttiness, caramel, toffee, char, orange peel, pine, herbal, and roast/smokey earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt, citrus/earthy hops, oak, and light-moderate fruity yeast flavors; with a great roast/hop bitter/sweet balance and zero astringent flavors lingering after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from roast/hop bitterness, that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy, and moderately sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent smoked Baltic porter style! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt, citrus/earthy hops, oak, and light-moderate fruity yeast flavors; and very smooth and easy to sip on for the ABV. This is definitely hoppy for the style while fresh, but not overdone; and has a lot of great classic Baltic porter complexities. A very enjoyable offering.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours Near black with a thick tan head and a smoky treacle aroma. There is a complex flavor that includes chocolate, dark molasses, coffee and oak. Quite smoky.

Pours black into an English pint. Mocha head with excellent retention recedes leaving sheet lacing. Chocolate and espresso aromas. Dry with sweet milk chocolate upfront turning to pine before the lasting charred pith finish. Nice.

Draft at Stone Tap House San Diego. Black in color with a nice lasting beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, earth, bark, and cherry. The flavor is nice, sweet yet roasty and mildly bitter. Earthy with coffee notes. Medium full bodied, smooth to drink. A good one.

Bomber from Costco. Aroma is roasty, chocolaty, vanilla, bready, minerals, licorice, light smoke, tobacco/leather. Pours black with a thin beige head that falls after a minute; second pour reveals a nice tan head with excellent retention. Taste is roasty and extremely bitter for style with flavors of licorice, coffee, light smoke; a good belch reveals flavors of green danky hops. Its good, but it would be better without the aggressive bitterness, but this is Stone after all and to be expected. Edit: the smoke character increases as it warms in the glass.

i tried to hold off beer 9k for the weekend, but the backlog is growing - so I figured a 100th percentile beer from one of my favorite brewers would suffice. Gotta say - dont know what the fuss is about on this one. I figured it would be an oak aged amped up smoked porter, but I like the smoked porter significantly more than this one. Nose is nice - oak, berries, light hops and dark malts. Flavor is overly oaky and finishes very dry. The porter part, and except for a slight aftertaste, the smoke part, are covered up too much. Still a pleasant enough beer, but with faults.

Very impressive porter! Quite flavorful, beautiful appearance...subtle smoke with very clear lively character. I will try to grab another to save for comparison with 7th anniversary... if I can keep from popping it before then.

Bottle. Aroma is sweetened coffee with mild chocolate and roast. Tastes like huge charred wood, moderate coffee, light sweetness up front, and a big bitter finish. Mild chocolate and pine too. Thin body but the bigger carb gives it a fuller mouthfeel. Very good porter.

Black pour, tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma is roasted coffee, light chocolate, light hop bitterness. Medium bodied, alcohol hidden well. I dont get any barrel notes here. Good concept and executed well but by todays standards I dont view this as a 4+/5 porter.
Interesting. Pours black with a small tan head. Campfire aroma. Taste is smoke, some cherry and chocolate. Dry, roasted, biting hop finish.

Bottle:
Nearly black....with a short tan head.
Light chocolate/cocoa powder scent.
Taste is bitter.....dark chocolate malt, coffee grounds...a lot of ash......no sweetness.....
Strong, dark and bitter elements in this one.
Roasty and a little smoky.
Dry.....really great.
Bottle from craft. One of the best porters Ive ever tasted. The deScription is spot on. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, cherries and wood. I need this again.

Bomber. Clear reddish brown with a creamy, beige head that lasts and laces. Aromas of roasted and burnt malts, smokey, coffee, chocolate, grapefruit, wood, pine, black cherry and vanilla. Flavor is mostly roasted malts and smokey notes, behind it is chocolate, wood, black cherry, pine, vanilla, grapefruit, and toffee. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry, roasty end.

Great God, this thing is a beast. This and the recent re-release of the Bitter Chocolate Oatmeal Stout really take Stones malt game to a new level. This beer pours jet back with little head, and the aroma is very strong, bitter malt and more very strong, bitter malt. The flavor adds a little bit of dark chocolate and boozy notes, but this thing never gets sweet and never even implies sweetness. Just sledgehammer roasted malt character that never wears out or backs down.

Pours black with a two finger khaki head with outstanding lacing. Aroma is of smoke, dark chocolate, roasted malts, dark roast coffee, berries,vanilla, pine, molasses, sweet malts, toffee,and cherries. Taste is similar to the aroma with a lot of nice smoked malts, chocolate, and full city coffee notes. Has a medium-full body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi bitter, slightly dry, long, lingering, smoked finish. Overall, a outstanding imperial porter that is very complex with a nice combination f smoke, chocolate, and coffee notes.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate chocolate, caramel, smoke, roast, oak, and a hint of cherry. It pours a dark brown that has some mahogany transparency when held to the light. It has a large beige head that has very good retention before settling to a thick film. There is a good amount of soapy webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate and lighter caramel. There is some light-moderate smoke in the middle. The finish has moderate roasted coffee, burnt notes, citrus hops, and a hint of vanilla. Its medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.
22oz bottle pours a black color with white head. Smooth smokey maltiness. Lots of hops that bland in nicely.
Aroma is malts, smoke/oak, vanilla and a hint of chocolate. The flavor is citrus/fruit, biscuit/dark malts, dark fruit, slight earthiness, smoke/bourbon chocolate and an acidic/tart finish.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with thick light tan head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is chocolate and a little coffee. Taste is moderately bitter a nice smokey finish. Flavors of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, smoked meats, caramel. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Unique aromas of metallic chocolate, funky cocoa nibs, oak, dark grain malt, barley, cherries, slight coffee and roasted malts. Pours black with very assertive foam and lacing in the glass. Taste brings carbonated chocolate, bitter coffee rinds, extremely dry cocoa nibs, oak, roasted malt, charred dark grain malt, espresso, toffee, burnt caramel and faint nuttiness. Finishes really dry with residual chocolate and coffee and very faint smoke. Overall, a very interesting take on a porter. Much more dry than most as well as boasting notes of funky cocoa and nuttiness.

2003 Bottle: Enjoyed in 2015, this baby has held up well. Aroma of malts, tanginess. Flavors of mellow chocolate, smoke, and some bitter fruit. Sweet and smoky aftertaste. Thanks Indiana_Red for pulling this out of the cellar.

Served from a bottle at Winter Storm 2011. I am so glad to actually be able to try this gem. The appearance is a more medium brown black with a micro light brown head. The aromas are rich with a medium dark chocolate, nice oak, and plenty of tasty malts. The flavors had more of that great rich chocolate, with loads of medium to medium full roasted malts, oak grain on the edges, and some oxidation. A touch of smoke in there as well. The mouth is medium to full bodied and moderately carbonated. A real treat that is still drinking great after 8 years. This is one I hope they revisit in the future!!

Slightly frothy tan head.  Aroma is roasted chocolate malt and earthy, faded hops.  Smooth feel in the mouth with a fair amount of classic porter roast toward the finish.  Some minimal dark fruit among the roasted character.  Drinking exceptionally well considering the eight years on the beer.

Sample from bottle at Stone Winter Storm 2011.  Dark brown pour, small light tan head.  Dark dried fruits, raisin, plum, chocolate, licorice, oxidation, light salty smoky pork.  Interesting porter, tasty and still tastes excellent after all these years.  Very glad to try it.

Stone Brewing Company--Stone 6th Anniversary Porter--2002 Release--22 oz. Bottle-8.01% ABV.  (4.5 / 5.0)  Porter--Imperial--Rich tight lacy espresso head.  Dark opaque black color.  Very roasted tangy earthy rich hop front.  Rich burnt smoky earthy grainy hot sweet espresso body.  Amped Smoked Porter.  Mild sediment.  Rich hot hop end.  Sampled 9/6/2003.

Bomber from EDA at the RNH Charity event.  THis used to be one of the best Porters, and while it still has held up nicely and drinks fine now, it has passed its peak a couple years ago by now.  Pours a nice deep dark charcoal brownish black with a medium foamy head- some lace.  Aroma is toffee, nutty big dark chocolates, earth some leather staleness creeping in with some chocolate covered cherries as it warms.  Flavor is black forrest cake, chocolate, fruity esters, cherries, slight slaty oxidation, with sherry hints, and meaty- hints of roast and smoke, good dry toast in the end and still a smooth finish.  Still real nice, but fading.

Bottle at RnH Drink for Charity.  Thanks to everyone who brought great beer to this.  Dark brown with ring and lace.  Chocolate, dark fruit and alcohol aroma.  Chocolate dark fruit licorice alcohol with medium bitter finish.  A little thin on the palate, but still pretty good.

Bottle shared by eyedrinkale at "Drink for Charity" event at Rattle N Hum.  Dark brown.  Chocolate, cocoa and light tobacco.    Cigar smoke and heavy leathery character.  There is a bit of licorice/anise richness with a bit of smokiness on the back.  Light peppery cooling finish on the back.  Excellent, really.

Bottle shared by EDA as part of a complete vertical. Nice complex porter, but the body has thinned significantly over the years, and I cant imagine this is even close to its prime anymore. Tobacco and chocolate aroma, mint, vanilla ice cream, with nice complexity. Bittersweet, deep brown flavor, covered by some wet dog and other oxidized notes.

Bottle at the Drink for Charity event at Rattle & Hum thanks to Mike who brought a vertical from 2nd to 12th. Finally one that wasnt a dead IPA.  The porter held up excellently.  Pours a deep black with a thick thin white head.  Gorgeous aromas of smoke, leather, tobacco, plum, prunes, chocolate.  Medium bodied with dark fruit flavors and a touch of chocolate.  Finishes with a touch of smoke and roast.  This was great.
Bottle Shared By EDA, thank you Mike.  Pours a dark brune body with a tan lacing.  Smoke, liquid smoke, woody character with char, hints of chocolate, and toffee.  Burnt malt and ash.  Good brew.

Bomber for a little celebration.  Poured coppery deeper brown with only a dusting of beige.  The aroma was rich with darker chocolate and molasses supporting ashy smoke and darker, earthy spices.. aged oak and alcohol warmth on the back.  The flavor opened with lightly sour smoke and oaky notes rolling into well-roasted dark chocolate, molasses, and light soy on the middle.. smoke had a wet ash character around.. bitterness was light and coffee-inspired.. decadent flourless cake-like chocolate and smoke on the finish.  Medium-bodied with little carbonation on the palate.. spicy and warm, with ideal influence from the smoke and the oak.. aged very, very gracefully!

Bottle thanks to the great people at the Bruery tasting. Pours with a dark brown body with no head. Aroma of dark fruits, tar, figs, caramel, dates, chocolate, oak and nuts. Taste of nuts, yeast, chocolate, and oak. Syrupy mouthfeel and light carbonation.

Bottle:  The finale at the back room tasting hosted at TFD Boise - Thanks Ken!  Dark brown, near black pour with a small tan head.  Aroma is roasty, dark fruit, and a little faded hops.  A touch of graham crackers and sweetness.  Tastes of coffee, bittersweet cocoa, and roasty.  Nice creamy mouthful.  Still maintains some light hoppiness.  Props to Stone, this aged like a champ.

Sampled at Sean and Ryans tasting in May; thanks Sean for throwing this rarity in! Black color with lighter edges, still some carbonation present and a hint of beige lacing. Aroma is mostly chocolate malt, smoke and some ashy plastic. The flavor is quite smooth, with more chocolate, burnt wood and some coffee grounds. Finishes with a light tang and lasting bitterness. It might be a bit past its prime, but a real treat to try.

Sampled at Sean and Ryans tasting party. Poured a deep dark reddish-brown. Huge aroma of malt and oak, and a bit of smoke. Taste starts sweet and then shifts into a big smokiness, with a bit of an alcohol bite. Lingering smokiness. Very tasty porter.

Finally got to try this.  Sean contributed this to his own tasting and hot damn I was psyched to try it.  Pours black with a tan ring.  Nose is smokey malty with a tiny bit of band aid.  Taste is quite smoky with chocolate and malty characteristics.  Very very nice, quite good.

I was cleaning out the cellar and ran across this gem,it was dark and thick with a nice chocolate and coffee flavor with some lingering smoke flavor,ABV is well hidden and flavor is smooth as silk.CHEERS!

Bottle at Stone Winter Storm.  Super dark brown, almost black color.  Very little carbonation.   Thick, rich, creamy beer.  Flavor is strong on the coffee and chocolate.  Very good.   Stone should really consider bringing this back.
Bottle at Stone Winter Storm.  Dark brown with no head.  Strong chocolate and roasty aroma.  Wonderful chocolate and drip coffee taste wit a smooth roasty finish
Pours a hazy brown color with a small brown head.  Aroma is smoky, woody, and vanilla.  Flavor is woody, vanilla, smoky, and a light bitter finish.

Pours dark brown with some sparse tan to light brown bubbles.  Smells of chocolate, molasses, some underlying smoky hints, a nice balance of bitterness and some dark fruit.  Tastes of nuts, dark chocolate, touches of coffee, some nice fruity elements and a nice balance of roastiness with hints of smoke.  One of the best porters I have had.  I wish this was a regular release or that I at least had another bottle of it!

22 oz. bottle shared by wetherel at the BA Alesmith release.  Thanks man!  Poured a dark brown color with a thin light tan head.  Thin lacing.  Aroma was roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee.  Flavor had was much of the same with some faint vanilla hidden in there.  Very smooth mouthfeel.  Medium body.  Still a very good beer.

22oz bottle, generously shared by wetherel at the pre-BA Alesmith Release Wait and Taste.  Thanks, John!  Pours a dark, cola brown color; light tan head with patchy lacing.  Dense, nougat and caramel in the aroma; milk chocolate and only mild oxidation; very well stored.  Very dense, chewy mouthfeel: smoky / roasted malts and chocolate upfront; soft at first, before the smoke and roasted malts hit, with chewy dark chocolate and an intense chewiness and density; excellent, smoke-infused porter, without too much smoke or too little; lengthy, roasted malts and smoke and dry chocolate finish.  Excellent.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Bottle bought at Stones secret release at Pizza Port bottle shop a few weeks ago, and shared with RB+ gang at Alesmith release.  Pretty good for a 5yr old beer.  Roasted grains have nicely mellowed.  Small bubble carbonation.  Black color.  Some caramelized malt.  Very little oxidation.  Nice level of smokiness, not overpowering, but not too mild either.

(sample tasted in line @ the ba alesmith release)dark brown with a light brown head.wonderful aroma of brown sugar,molasses,oak,and chocolate.the flavor blends up the aroma with some heavy smoke and some vanilla.i like it but i think the smoke overpowered it a bit.

Wish I had been able to taste more of this from its release to now. As I have no comparison, well no comparison. But can say that I really ejoyed it. Subtle and exceptionally easy to  quaff. All had mellowed in most favorable manor. Can someone send me another?

C-bus7, bottle shared by Moejuck and spector. Brown pour with a light tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and bitter roasted malt. Flavors of chocolate, light caramel malt, light smoke and coffee. Medium body with a bitter roastiness throughout...bittersweet finish.

Poured a little medium black color that was not opaque. Aroma was of chocolate and some smooth and a slight bitterness. Flavor was very tastey and chocolatey. Not really getting any smokiness in this one at all. Maybe a little smoke in the aroma at the end. This showed some oxidation.
C-bus7.  Light malt and oxidation in the aroma.  Dark brown body with a medium palate.  Light chocolate and tons of oxidation on this one.  It is definitely past its prime.

Bottle shared by LBHH, thanks Glenn. Pours a dark soy sauce with little to no head. Aroma was very hoppy for a porter, but well balanced and driven by smokiness, with hints of dark fruit, cordial cherries, and roasted malts, finished off by a good kick of alcohol. The body is thin, but creamy. Flavor is nice, with lots of smoky malt presence and a port like fruit character.
